​App Name: AgriBid
​Short Description: A direct-to-market platform that uses AI to connect farmers directly with companies and exporters for fair, transparent, and efficient trade of coffee, teff, and other agricultural products. Eliminates brokers and middlemen.  
​Full Description:
​AgriBid is an AI-powered marketplace app designed to revolutionize the agricultural supply chain. It will serve three primary user roles: Farmers, Companies (local buyers), and Exporters. The app’s goal is to create a seamless, direct-from-farm-to-buyer ecosystem, ensuring fair pricing for farmers and transparent, quality-assured sourcing for buyers.  
​Key User Roles & Goals:
​Farmer: A farmer can register and create a profile. Their main goal is to list their produce, get a fair price, and find a buyer without a broker.
​Company/Exporter: A company or exporter can search for specific products, assess quality, and purchase products directly from a farmer. Their goal is to find high-quality products efficiently and at a good price.
​Core Features and User Flows:
​User Registration and Profile Creation:
​Allow users to sign up with their mobile number or email.  
​Create three separate account types: Farmer, Company, and Exporter.
​A farmer's profile should include location, farm size, and a list of their products.
​A company/exporter's profile should include their business details and what products they are looking for.
​AI-Powered Product Listing (Main Feature):
​A farmer can create a new product listing for a crop (e.g., coffee, teff).
​The farmer uploads a photo of their produce.
​AI Function: An integrated AI model analyzes the image to automatically assess and provide a quality grade for the crop. This assessment should be displayed on the product listing.
​The farmer enters the quantity, price per unit, and location.
​Marketplace and Search:
​A company or exporter can view all available product listings on a main feed.
​Implement a search and filter system based on crop type (e.g., "coffee," "teff"), quality grade, location, and price.
​In-App Communication:
​A secure chat feature that allows farmers and buyers to communicate directly and negotiate details.
​The chat should be linked to specific product listings.
​Transaction and Order Management:
​A buyer can place an order for a specific quantity of a product from a farmer.
​The farmer receives a notification and can accept or decline the offer.
​Once an order is accepted, both parties should see an "Order Status" page to track the transaction. This should include an option for secure payment integration (e.g., with a local mobile money provider or a bank).
​Logistics and Tracking (Future Feature):
​AI Function: An AI algorithm can suggest optimal shipping and logistics partners to the buyer, based on the location of the farm and the delivery address. This feature can be implemented in a later version.
​Required Integrations (for AI and Functionality):
​Firebase/Google Cloud: For user authentication, database management, and cloud functions.  
​AI Model Hosting: A cloud-based service to host the image-recognition model for quality assessment.
​Mobile Money/Payment Gateway API: To facilitate payments within the app.

- AI-Powered Product Listing: Enable farmers to create product listings with image uploads, AI-assessed quality grades, quantity, price, and location.
- Marketplace and Search: Develop a main feed for product listings with search and filter options based on crop type, quality grade, location, and price.

Design Elements:

- Colors: Use a base color that reflects agriculture (e.g., earthy green), a primary text color that ensures readability, and accent colors to highlight key elements.
- Typography: Choose modern, clean fonts that convey trust and efficiency.
